weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the atmosphere presents a mixed but generally inviting tableau, with a canvas of partly sunny skies that gradually gives way to an encroaching evening gloom. While the high temperature hovers around the mid-fifties, a notable chill threads through the air, hinting at the cooler moments ahead as the sun begins to wane. For those wandering the streets, the serenity is punctuated by gentle northeast winds, allowing a touch of warmth, yet one should be mindful that the evening brings with it the promise of rain, sweeping in after ten o'clock, when the sky will be draped in thick clouds and a low of forty-seven will settle in.

The prospect of rain looms ominously, with a robust 90% chance anticipated, promising new droplets that may accumulate softly upon the rooftops. As day turns to night, the marine layer may linger in the shadows of the Golden Gate, casting a muted spell over the landscape, while hints of fog could caress the edges of the hills. Dressing in layers provides a wise strategy; a light jacket will shield against the creeping cold, while an umbrella tucked within reach promises readiness for the impending drizzle. With the forecast of rain, one might consider the simple joys of staying indoors—perhaps a leisurely coffee at a neighborhood café or a quiet moment in a bookshop, taking refuge from the elements as the world outside transforms under the drumming of raindrops.
